metadata.title: USN-4694-1 -- Linux kernel vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that the LIO SCSI target implementation in the Linux kernel performed insufficient identifier checking in certain XCOPY requests. An attacker with access to at least one LUN in a multiple backstore environment could use this to expose sensitive information or modify data.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-4694-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-image-4.4.0-200-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-200.232~14.04.1 linux-image-4.4.0-200-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-200.232~14.04.1 linux-image-4.4.0-200-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-200.232~14.04.1 linux-image-4.4.0-200-lowlatency - 4.4.0-200.232~14.04.1 linux-image-4.4.0-200-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-200.232~14.04.1 linux-image-4.4.0-200-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-200.232~14.04.1 linux-image-4.4.0-200-generic - 4.4.0-200.232~14.04.1 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro  linux-image-powerpc-smp-lts-xenial - 4.4.0.200.175 linux-image-lowlatency-lts-xenial - 4.4.0.200.175 linux-image-powerpc64-emb-lts-xenial - 4.4.0.200.175 linux-image-powerpc64-smp-lts-xenial - 4.4.0.200.175 linux-image-generic-lpae-lts-xenial - 4.4.0.200.175 linux-image-powerpc-e500mc-lts-xenial - 4.4.0.200.175 linux-image-generic-lts-xenial - 4.4.0.200.175 linux-image-virtual-lts-xenial - 4.4.0.200.175 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
